title: A relation of the last words and departure of that antient and honourable woman Loveday Hambly of Trigangeeues, in the parish of Austell in the County of Cornwal. With farther testimonies concerning her life and conversation.
author: Hambly, Loveday, 1603 or 4-1682.
publisher: printed by John Gain, living in the Upper Moor-Fields, near the Flying-Horse,
notes: Sometimes attributed to Loveday Hambly. In fact a series of letters written in honor of Loveday Hambly, who died on "the 14th of the 10th month 1682 .." [p. 11] and who "hath, by reason of old age, great weekness and many infirmities kept her bed for the most part this seven weeks, being aged about seventy eight years .." [p. 4].
Reproduction of the original in the Friends' House Library, London.
